meanings.sent1: The floor was unlevel, causing the ball to roll to one side.
meanings.sent2: The unlevel table wobbled whenever something heavy was placed on it.
meanings.sent3: The unlevel ground made it tricky to play a game of marbles.
meanings.sent4: Her unlevel haircut made her look like she had just been caught in a windstorm.
meanings.sent5: The unlevel painting on the wall gave the room a quirky charm.

meanings.definition: To make something not level or even.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally unlevelled the shelf while trying to hang a picture.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to unlevel the ground when digging for the new tree.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to enjoy unlevelling the neatly stacked books.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds unlevelled the fence, leaving it in a twisted mess.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew had to fix the unlevel foundation before building the house.
